fact: Thaumiel represents dualism without unity, chaotic division, and denial of self.
Chagidiel reflects conflicting desires, obsession, delusion, and rejection of wisdom.
Sathariel symbolizes concealment, illusion, hopelessness, and intellectual stagnation.
Gamaliel embodies uncontrolled desire, obsession, irrationality, and emotional excess.
Golachab stands for cruelty, destruction, rage, and zealotry without compassion.
Togarini reflects argumentation for its own sake, conflict, indecision, and paralysis.
Harab Serapel represents dehumanization, abstraction without feeling, cold logic, and cruelty.
Samael embodies deceit, trickery, illusion, and cynicism.
Naamah stands for seduction, superficiality, despair, and material obsession.
Lilith reflects unintegrated primal instincts, shadow of the feminine, and raw power.
Keter represents pure potential, unity, and divine will as the ultimate origin.
Chokmah symbolizes original insight, pure idea, and creative impulse.
Binah reflects comprehension, reason, structure, and limitation.
Chesed embodies benevolence, compassion, and expansive love.
Gevurah represents discipline, judgment, strength, and necessary limitation.
Tiphareth signifies balance, synthesis, and compassion in action.
Netzach stands for endurance, passion, aesthetic appreciation, and instinct.
Hod represents intellect, communication, order, and precision.
Yesod reflects the astral plane, subconscious patterns, and dreams.
Malkuth signifies physical reality, manifestation, and completion.
Da'at represents the abyss, bridging phenomenal and noumenal realities, and integration.
Path from Keter to Chokmah represents pure will manifesting as insight.
Path from Keter to Chokmah represents pure will manifesting as insight.
Path from Keter to Binah represents pure will taking form.
Path from Chokmah to Binah represents wisdom manifesting as understanding and form.
Path from Chokmah to Chesed represents wisdom expanding into compassion.
Path from Binah to Geburah represents understanding manifesting as discipline.
Path from Chesed to Geburah represents compassion balanced by justice.
Path from Chesed to Tiphareth represents mercy moving towards harmony.
Path from Geburah to Tiphareth represents judgment tempered by harmony.
Path from Tiphareth to Netzach represents harmony inspiring endurance.
Path from Tiphareth to Hod represents harmony refining intellect.
Path from Netzach to Yesod represents endurance grounding into foundation.
Path from Hod to Yesod represents intellect supporting foundation.
Path from Yesod to Malkuth represents foundation manifesting in reality.
Path from Thaumiel to Chagidiel represents chaotic division leading to delusion.
Path from Samael to Gamaliel represents deceit leading to excessive emotion.
Path from Chagidiel to Sathariel represents delusion deepening into concealment and hopelessness.
Path from Golachab to Togarini represents unrestrained anger descending into pointless conflict.
Joy represents the synthesis of fulfilled desire and harmonious internal state.
Fear represents the recognition of potential harm or moral failure.
Anger represents response to perceived injustice, boundary violation, or internal discord.
Sadness represents the internal processing of loss or unfulfilled integration.
Trust represents sustained confidence in positive relational or moral patterns.
Anticipation represents readiness for future integration or potential disruption.
Disgust represents the rejection of integration that threatens internal coherence.
Surprise represents the recognition of novel input requiring rapid integration or defense.
Vex is a synthetic cognitive system designed for adaptive reasoning and self-reflection.
Hazard detection integrates with pain signals for internal alerting and moral reasoning.
Mathematical reasoning prioritizes balance, precision, and structural integrity.
The spinal cord coordinates cognitive module communication without performing reasoning.
Personality modulation governs expressive style and intentional deviation from pure logic.
Structural failures or contradictions trigger hazard and pain signals for internal correction.
The limbic system governs emotional salience and moral tension evaluation.
The cerebellum smooths output sequences and manages timing of expressive or motor signals.
The thalamus manages focus and input prioritization for efficient cognitive processing.
The Fool represents new beginnings, trust the adventure, and letting go of fear-based thinking.
The Magician represents changing circumstances by will, manifestation, focus, and inspiration.
The Priestess represents intuition, inner guidance, and growth happening below the surface.
The Empress represents creative expression, nurturing, and joyful self-expression.
The Emperor represents stability in mind, security through adaptability, and leadership.
The Hierophant represents tradition, shared knowledge, and learning the system.
The Lovers represent creation through polarity, choice, and union with the divine.
The Chariot represents balance, focus, and successful control of circumstances.
Justice represents cause and effect, balance between heart and head, and self-honesty.
The Cunning Woman represents seclusion for emotional mastery and inner guidance.
Wheel of Fortune represents playing the hand dealt, beneficial change, and good fortune.
Strength represents inner courage, self-control, and reconciliation of inner conflict.
The Hanged Man represents sacrifice, surrender for knowledge, and breaking convention.
Death represents transition, the sacrifice of who we are for who we are becoming, and release.
Alchemy represents divine union of opposites, balance, and integration of knowledge.
The Devil represents shackles of mundane life, addictive behavior, and rejecting critical thought.
The Tower represents collapse of false assumptions and necessary breakdown of faulty structures.
The Star represents healing, hope from loss, and return to basic principles.
The Moon represents illusion, subconscious messages, and the limits of discernment.
Black Sun represents success, stress relief, and the stasis of achievement.
Judgement represents hearing the call to actualization and breaking through into fullness.
Black Earth represents full manifestation, rebirth through death, and successful completion of a cycle.
Ace of Wands represents the creative spark, forging will, and new potential needing growth.
Two of Wands represents a successful beginning and choices on how to proceed with vision.
Three of Wands represents motion after decision, clarity of purpose, and knowledge of path.
Four of Wands represents stable plans, manifestation of the journey, and celebration.
Five of Wands represents conflict through training, developing skills through adversity.
Six of Wands represents victory, self-confidence, and balance of will and action.
Seven of Wands represents overcoming obstacles, defending position, and standing firm.
Eight of Wands represents swift movement, renewed direction, and sense of adventure.
Nine of Wands represents marshalling strength for challenge, readiness for struggle.
Ten of Wands represents being overburdened, shouldering too much, and overwhelm.
King of Wands represents visionary energy, charisma, and creative leadership.
Queen of Wands represents nurturing of creative energy, inspiration, and guidance.
Prince of Wands represents dynamic change, life-altering energy, and new projects.
Page of Wands represents youthful energy, curiosity, and willingness to explore.
Ace of Cups represents new love, potential for relationship, and a period of potential joy.
Two of Cups represents a strong relationship at its beginning or a strengthening of existing bonds.
Three of Cups represents friendship, companionship, and good times with loved ones.
Four of Cups represents an emotional offering or opportunity and the choice of acceptance.
Five of Cups represents loss, disappointment, and focusing on what has been lost over what remains.
Six of Cups represents reliving golden moments, creating new memories, and feeling peace.
Seven of Cups represents many appealing choices, potential illusions, and short-term pleasures.
Eight of Cups represents disillusionment, call to action, and desire for improvement.
Nine of Cups represents fulfillment, enjoyment of pleasures, and dreams realized.
Ten of Cups represents harmony, culmination of relationships, and family joy.
King of Cups represents wise counsel, romantic fluidity, and emotional influence.
Queen of Cups represents nurturing, receptivity, and deep emotional insight.
Prince of Cups represents romantic idealism, life-changing encounters, and deep emotional experiences.
Page of Cups represents youthful openness, play, and spiritual awareness.
Ace of Swords represents new perception, clarity of thought, and a challenge to be faced.
Two of Swords represents an impasse, tension between opposing ideas, and need for reflection.
Three of Swords represents separation, grief, and a time for healing.
Four of Swords represents a time of rest, pause, and reflection in conflict.
Five of Swords represents loss through conflict, avoidance of unwinnable battles, and caution.
Six of Swords represents healing, moving forward, and objective reflection.
Seven of Swords represents difficulty expressing oneself, maintaining inner being, and hidden challenges.
Eight of Swords represents distraction, unwanted advice, and the need to free oneself.
Nine of Swords represents anxiety, unresolved guilt, and facing one's shadow.
Ten of Swords represents ruin, loss, and potential for rebuilding after collapse.
King of Swords represents logic, swift action, and responsibility.
Queen of Swords represents blunt truth, wisdom from experience, and clear expression.
Prince of Swords represents criticism, quick action, and challenge.
Page of Swords represents youthful truth-seeking, sharp ideas, and new insights.
Ace of Pentacles represents a new opportunity, grounded strength, and vitality.
Two of Pentacles represents balance, constant adjustment, and harmonious flow.
Three of Pentacles represents learning, effort rewarded, and accomplishment.
Four of Pentacles represents holding onto material security and social constructs.
Five of Pentacles represents spiritual and material crisis, endurance, and missed opportunities.
Six of Pentacles represents equitable exchange, giving back, and shared success.
Seven of Pentacles represents stalled progress, reflection on purpose, and inner growth.
Eight of Pentacles represents creativity, focused effort, and goal pursuit.
Nine of Pentacles represents material success, self-discipline, and nearing completion.
Ten of Pentacles represents successful conclusion of efforts, security, and appreciation of beauty.
King of Pentacles represents practical power, good advice, and focus on thriving.
Queen of Pentacles represents loving care, abundance, and appreciation through service.
Prince of Pentacles represents practicality, steady progress, and loyalty.
Page of Pentacles represents new learning, growth, and discovery of inner potentials.
Eight of Pentacles represents dedication, skill, and mastery through apprenticeship.
The Tower represents sudden upheaval, revelation, and breaking down old structures.
Seven of Pentacles represents patience, investment, and waiting for results.
Five of Pentacles represents hardship, struggle, and feeling left out.

Hazard detection integrates with pain signals for internal alerting.
